reviews.text: I have now stayed here for two weekends during visits for my daughter who is a freshman at Georgetown. There are great hotels everywhere, but this is by far our favorite. The customer service is simply outstanding. I feel like we are traveling to our second home. The staff is so sincere and accommodating in every way!  We love the location and convenience to all that Georgetown offers. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel which makes it ideal. Can't wait to return!

This is my first Google review; I simply felt compelled to give this place a shout out. Yes, the rooms are spacious and comfortable, the location cannot be beaten, the price is very fair, but it’s the staff that makes this place so very special. From the front desk agent to the bartender to the server in the restaurant, I’ve never encountered more genuinely friendly hotel staff anywhere I’ve ever been. Thank you for making my being stranded by a cancelled flight such a wonderful experience!

Clean room; one of two tv's not working, one of front desk person announced that someone on the staff using her name was out with COVID. two phones not working, one of two sinks not working. Called front desk...engineering never showed.  Booked five rooms and each of our five guests had complaints from noise to awkward furniture to tvs not works. Convenient location.

Tiny room, no water pressure in the sink.
We made our reservation directly with the hotel well in advance of our stay.  The hotel was not full.  Our room 408 was tiny, no water pressure in the sink, the coffee maker did not work.  We have stayed at the Georgetown inn numerous times in the past.  This stay was very disappointing.
Our 4th stay here. We LOVE it. The only place we stay in DC. Close to everything you want to do. Great staff and the food (especially breakfast) is delicious

The food is delicious, the place is decorated beautiful with Christmas decorations besides its classy and upscale look. Wasn't able to try a drink I was recommended to try by the server but overall great experience. Place is located in a great location which is great if your wanting to get great photos with friends/family. Parking Garage is 2 minutes away in walking distance to this restaurant which is very convenient. 👍🏾

Amazing customer service! The outdoor dining is just soo extremely gorgeous, spacious and clean in every way. You have a lovely view of the water, the Sweden Embassy, and just the river! The food was just next level, specially the octopus that was cooked to perfection and I will certainly have it again when I come back to bring my boyfriend.

The Best Sunday Brunch in the DMV area hands down! Omelette Station, Chicken and Waffles, Crab Cakes made on the spot, Cheese Grits, Bacon, Salmon, Crab Legs, Salads, Milkshake, Bottomless Mimosas.... on and on! This is not your regular buffet. There is a 2 hour time limit and it is a bit pricey, about $100pp, but definitely worth it! The only negative I had was the Crab Legs were not seasoned and cold (over ice). This place is a must try. The atmosphere is amazing as well.

First off, I'm thrilled they are open again! The outdoor dining is amazing.  I had the best fried calamari I've had in years. They have a new fresh juice drink menu from the bar that was delicious. My only issue is the new decor inside is a bit odd. It was always such a beautiful, classically designed restaurant which looks like someone got happy with bright colors from the 80s on the walls. I'm not sure what is up with that?  Since the bones are still elegant and classic, hopefully they will paint the walls and remove some odd lights or artwork to get back to the original place.

Very disappointing. Location is spectacular. Food was very subpar. The crab cakes in particular were so disappointing. According to a server there was cayenne pepper in the crab cakes that's their words not mine when we asked about the spice and it was so overwhelming it ruined a great lump crab cake. No filler at all. All crab meat but it was way beyond spicy to enjoy. Also....french fries with crab cakes? Odd. The short ribs were good in spots but also dry too dry to enjoy. Overall it was an underwhelming meal at an above average price point. Plenty of other places to go and try around here.

name: Farmers Fishers Bakers
vicinity: Harbour at The Georgetown Waterfront, 3000 K St NW, The Washington, Washington

reviews.text: This is a great place for tasty, creative food, and delicious cocktail. They feature many different house-made drinks and locally sourced ingredients. We went at 6:00 on a Thursday evening for a nice dinner before hitting a 7:30 show at the Kennedy Center. We made a reservation (for 2) but probably didn't need it, although the place was reasonably full when we arrived. I'd still recommend reservations just to be safe. They have a wide variety of entrees that should be able to accommodate most eating preferences. Everything we had was excellent quality and prepared perfectly. Note - we ordered one app, two entrees, and three cocktails and our bill came to $150 including tax&tip.

Loved loved loved the menu! So many options from purple & Black salads, Bacon onion blue cheese burgers, and spicy tuna rolls to chicken and waffles, garlic black pepper wings, and calamari pizzas. The popcorn we ordered was delicious (a little burnt at the bottom), but the rest of it was fun and tasty! I ordered the cedar plank salmon and the sauce was AMAZING! The fish was nice and soft, but not mushy at all. The green beans were also cooked to perfection. The other people I went with also enjoyed their meals. While we didn’t order dessert, we really should have! Our neighbors ordered dessert and it looked sooooooo good!

The service from the hostess to the servers was beyond exceptional. They were willing to clear tables that they weren't serving. We asked a different server for a to go box...she took our dirty plates and brought us boxes back to pack our food (She didn't just pass it our server.) Food was good. Chocolate chip cookies were 🔥. Great atmosphere. Worth it for the time it takes to prepare scratch food. The Fishers Fryer and Bourbon Sour in the picture.

The place was busy definitely a locally loved spot. Personally the cheaper of a lot of the restaurants without risking quality at all . I had the grilled cheese burger and it was immaculate. My drink was made by our server/bartender Mateo, it was not only absolutely gorgeous but got me feeling just right. He was attentive and helpful, and also helped me with my drink request. Definitely not a disappointment and worth taking a trip to!

Big letdown. Everything about this place looks cool, but the food is not worth the price. Got the fried chicken jambalaya and it came with a salad on top. The salad was gross. The chicken was a thigh and a breast, but it had the bones in. You hardly get any meat and it is difficult to eat. It was the same with the chicken and waffles. The chicken was the same way with bones. The green beans were blah and the meal came with a lemon sauce, which is weird.

The drinks were pretty good because they make their own spirits. The waitstaff was very nice, but if you have allergies don’t bother coming here. Everything has peppers and there is not much that can be made. They tried, but at least they do say that on their website. The restaurant recovery fee is bogus and 5%. They must need a lot of recovery.

Final score: 2.3

There are better ways to spend $100. Come here for drinks, not food.

I loved their Easter decorations! They really went all out and the decorations are more classic too and remind me of better times! Their bread appetizer with olive oil is very tasty and the wait service was impeccable. The waiter misheard my original order, but they quickly corrected it and got me my correct dish. Both of our dishes were delicious and had plenty of sauce. The dessert was scrumptious too! All of these were a reasonable price as well. If you are going out for a date, I highly recommend this place! It’s so far my favorite Italian restaurant in DC!

This restaurant is def worth the hype!  The vibes is right. The service is amazing.  Super friendly and fun. But most importantly the food is amazing!!!

It’s kinda expensive but the portions are massive! We were two people and ordered an app and 2 pastas and took home so much food. Ate the leftovers for breakfast the next day and it was still amazing.

This restaurant feels a bit like a tourist trap mixed with a long time establishment and it’s done in a way were it doesn’t feel tacky. It’s fun and lively and good for so many occasions.  Date night,  big group dinners, just visiting town for a moment.

10/10 recommend and can’t wait to go back!

This place no doubt one of the best dining experiences in DMV. The service is top notch, the Italian wine options are great, pricey but nice selection. Amazing food menu to select from, all scratch everything. The veal is always my go to, can't get a bad meal here. Don't even bother trying save room for dessert just order it anyways and hate yourself in the morning.

I was pleasantly surprised during date night at Filomena’s last week. We were seated without a reservation within 10 minutes of arriving and received excellent customer service. Both of our meals were ridiculously delicious and the bread was so soft! I really savored every bite of my risotto and give my hubby a thumbs up for a excellent restaurant pick.

Absolutely great experience. Wonderful Christmas decorations and ambience. The service was incredible - my gf and I decided to share multiple entrees and they timed them coming out accordingly. They also boxed up leftovers as requested throughout the meal!  Pro tip - the portions are large so a couple can split and entree, or you can take home and enjoy the next day like we did!!

Really cool restaurant, the hidden back area has a lot of charm, both classy and cozy! The menu was pretty varied (found veggie options for me) and well priced. I would say the salads could be a little less lettuce and a lot more of the other 6-8 ingredients they list (took off a star for that). Their hummus plate was great, and beautifully presented (see picture). Overall would recommend, it was really lovely to have lunch there on a weekend :)! Oh, and they give you $10 off your next visit (within 30 days), in your receipt.

This is a great location, which means long waits during busy hours, especially on weekends. The inside feels a little crammed and you may have to squeeze your way to the table or the bathroom. Avoid large groups as it may be challenging to sit together, or call ahead to ask. I really like the outdoor seating that they added, most places in Georgetown need to do the same. The food was tasty and came out relatively fast, portions were ok. The service was not bad, but I was hoping for more. We would go back for sure, but there are so many things to explore around Georgetown.

Went there for dinner with the family and kids.
First of all the place is children friendly - they brought paper and colors for the kids and the kids loved the pasta meal.
The service was also great.
All meals were tasty and comforting.
The price was reasonable.
We will visit again.
Recommended!

Omg, We had the best time. Our server Isaiah was perfect. Laughed at all our jokes, recommended food that we will never forget. Cocktails were amazing. Restaurant was clean and staff was friendly. The next time we are in DC we are definitely going back to Clyde's of Georgetown.

Delicious burgers. Although this establishment has some fancy offerings, the burgers have been wonderful and become a favorite of mine. Cooked just how you like and with quality toppings. The nacho are a good appetizer if you’re looking for something casual. They too have plenty of cheese and other toppings. Service has always been excellent. Prices are reasonable for the area.

My Husband and I were looking for a place to have a breakfast and we found this place as a surprise! The food was great and the Cappuccino also!

It was was a great experience! The staff was so nice! And wasn’t overpriced at all! We certainly want to go back!

Ok experience. Borderline 3/4 stars. The cheeseburger (pictured below) was mediocre. The fries were bland and very thin, almost noodle-like. The patty itself was alright but certainly didn’t justify the $17.50 price tag; I also requested medium rare, but it came out medium well/well done (something I wouldn’t really care about for a cheaper burger).

Some redeeming factors:
- the waitstaff were very kind and accommodating
- my mom loved her tuna salad (also pictured); perhaps I should’ve known better than to order a burger at a place like this

Fabulous experience!  The service was fantastic.  The food was beautifully plated and packed with delicious flavors.  Our adult beverages were equally as enjoyable.  The vibe was upbeat with an energetic atmosphere.

Was looking for a place to have late breakfast in Georgetown while visiting DC in Oct 2022 and decided to stop here.
First of all, a place that calls itself "café" needs to have good coffee. Both my wife and I were extremely disappointed by the latté that basically comes in a soup bowl as you can see in the picture.
Food was OK, I ordered fish, my wife ordered the house eggs benedict and the kids got burgers. I feel all the portions including the burgers were small. Everything but the fish came with a lot of fries, that didn't really appear to be fresh house cut, more like frozen supermarket fries. Nothing memorable.
Amazing food, great location, attentive staff. We had brunch and the tomato bisque, the quiche, and the Chesapeake Benedict. Amazing! Probably the best Hot Toddy I've ever had in my life.
Always sweetgreen style and that means: very good! The higher level is really beautiful for dining in. Friendly staff as well.
Excellent salads. Their homemade Minty Peach Fresca drink was amazing. We had the Summer Corn Bowl and the Green Goddess Avocado Salad. All was delicious! Can't wait to come back.

There is absolutely no way that this place actually has a 4.3 star rating... I work right next door and 9 times out of 10 receive chicken on my salad even though my orders are always vegetarian. I even cut out chickpeas from my order to see if that would help since the word looks kind of like chicken... Gave them several passes because of the pandemic but at this point it's just pure incompetence. I've emailed customer service probably 5 times in the past month. Total joke.
The broccoli in my salad was slimy. I had to throw it away. I ordered extra dressing and did not get it.
Salads were quite good. Seating was not - better to take your meal to the little park across the street or down to the waterfront.

name: Kafe Leopold
vicinity: 3315 Cady's Alley, NW Between 33rd & 34th off of M St on the canal side, Cady's Alley Northwest, Washington

reviews.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Georgetown. If you want to be transported to Europe, this is the place. Great food & desserts. I've eaten here for brunch, lunch, & dinner. I always enjoy the food. It's on the pricier side, but worth it. Servers are friendly. When people visit me from out of town, I make sure we eat at Kafe Leopold at least once 😉

Kafe Leopold is a gem. I had breakfast multiple times and dinner once and the food is spectacular. The atmosphere and ambience are very nice, and the staff are extremely kind and welcoming. For breakfast I had the almond croissant, soft boiled eggs, and the Belgian waffle. All were excellent. For dinner I had the bratwurst and the celery sauerkraut, both excellent. For dessert I had the affogato with rum which was a tasty and delicious treat to end my meal. The somewhat hidden location on a cobblestone Georgetown side street only adds to the unique charm of this great restaurant. I can't wait to return very soon.

This is my favorite place to brunch in DC; the sweet brunch menu is all delicious. As a big dessert person, I love that they have many shared and individual desserts to choose from. The pastry chef, Luigi Herve, makes only marvels.

I gave 4 stars for service merely because though attentive, the waiters each time I went either were frighteningly polite, almost obsequious, as though they would be tormented if their smile were to break, or commented on my large appetite (female), which is due to my weightlifting regimen.

Anyway, the food is impeccable, delicious, and interesting. I cannot recommend this place more if you need brunch or lunch in DC.

Kafe Leopold is a quality restaurant. It’s modern interior is clean and reminded me of a
High end furniture store.
The food is made with quality ingredients and one can tell that each dish was made with a lot of attention and thought.
The plum pancakes were delicious but took 20 minutes to arrive since they are made fresh to order. The ravioli was very tasty but a bit too oily for my liking.

Busy little cafe with thoughtfully crafted breakfast items. I went with a large group and was able to sample a good portion of the menu. Everything was good, especially the spatzle. I didn’t, however, quite like the Austrian coffee with milk. Not sure why but it didn’t sit well with me. They also have plenty of cakes to choose from. We chose the green one with strawberries. It was very sweet but the strawberries mellowed out the sweetness a bit.

An excellent fine dining restaurant with great food in a relaxing setting. Being in a former home allowed us to relax once seated. The service was impeccable. The takes on classic dishes was surprisingly modern. The price point was high but I have no regrets.

Had an excellent time grabbing dinner here! The food was absolutely amazing, and the art on the walls was fun to look at and made for great conversation.

I ordered the eggplant and butternut squash soup. It was literally the best soup I have ever had in my life, absolutely amazing. The wine list was excellent as well.

Really recommend for a private romantic date night!

Fine dining at its best, this iconic restaurant is located in a beautifully renovated Federal house. The main dining room has a fire place giving it a very cozy atmosphere. The staff is incredibly professional and work together like a well-trained team. The food was exceptional. This is a must go when visiting Washington DC. Do not forget to make a reservation, very hard to get in!

Last night in Georgetown and we wanted to try this Michelin star restaurant as a treat To end our thanksgiving weekend and 1789 Restaurant did not disappoint, it blew our tastes buds away! The butter squash soup we started out with was so amazing that we knew the rest of the dishes would get better and better. Be sure to take a video of how they present the soup…it happened so fast,  great presentation. I had the brioche halibut and My tastebuds were just in heaven. Our bellies were full but we still wanted to enjoy the evening w deserts and it did not disappoint as well! Service was excellent  ⭐️ ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ And the food was delivered quick. This is my new favorite restaurant in Georgetown by far and looking forward to coming back again!

We had such a great experience visiting 1789.  The food was delicious, the waiters were pleasant and the manager was so knowledgeable.  He knew all the history and even about the Exorcist house and steps directly across the street.  We enjoyed short ribs and sirloin, my brother in law had the halibut, we also tried the lobster and the octopus starters.  They were so good.  They even called our cab for us. We will def. return on our next visit to Georgetown.
1789 is located at 126 36 St.NW 20007

It's... OK. Not the worst. Not the best.

Olive Garden quality food with the prices of a 5-star fine dining establishment. Waiter was not rude... but was also not the friendliest either... if you know what I mean. The desert was brought out in a jar... like I understand you guys wanna be creative and artistic but come on... just give me the piece of cake on a dish - but maybe that's the peasant in me talking.

Beautiful place, centrally located in Georgetown and walking distance to everything! I was warmly greeted  by the host/hostess as they verified my reservation. I went during lunch so I didn’t really need one, but I always like to be prepared. It was 12 noon exact.

Food: I ordered the chef’s special. Taste of the pasta was fantastic. Great flavors, fresh but perhaps since it was the special, it may have been prepared in advance, because from the time I ordered it took maybe 6 minutes before it came out, arriving at the same time as the drinks.

The bread was nothing to rave about (hard and cold) and I actually had to ask them to bring a saucer and prepare the olive oil and red wine vinegar for dipping. Not as if they forgot, but it was as though it was not the norm. That may be my uncultured ignorance or maybe it was poor service but I was a little disappointed with that and the timing— especially given the fact that they noted it could take up to 20 minutes for them to prepare fresh pasta to order every time.  Like I said, my pasta was fantastic (albeit lukewarm).

Service: The main server was attentive, but the gentleman who was pouring the water or working alongside the server was somewhat off putting and inattentive. Maybe he was new.

Costs: $118 for two pasta dishes & two drinks + 1 coffee. No salad. No soup. Complimentary chilled bread and water.

Would I go Back? Maybe, if only to redeem the service. Pasta, no matter how good or fresh should not cost an average of $45 per plate, in my honest opinion. I enjoyed it better in Rome, at a fraction of the cost.

What an amazing Thanksgiving treat it was for me too spend it with my 2 college kids in almost 10 years together and get a reservation at Cafe Milano.
Dinner was fabulous, there’s nothing you will order that won’t disappoint. We enjoyed trying each other meals and each was a delight and ended up overloading our tummies with desert that was icing on the cake on top of our delish meals. My second visit to this fab place and always treated with VIP service.

When I am DC for business… I always have to dine in at Cafe Milano… is still a classic pick for D.C. restaurant-lovers. I recognized the consistent quality of service! Food was outstanding and incredible! I loved that branzino fish fillet. The waiter, host and hostess made us feel welcomed, the server was so tentative! Very friendly, a place where you have to dressed up not dress down! Looking forward to coming back! Side note! Make reservations at advance notice!

Miriam greeted me so warmly with her Italian women warmth! I’ll be back just because of her. My meal began with a bread service accompanied by some extra virgin olive oil for dipping. I ordered an insalatina featuring a butter lettuce, lemon vinaigrette, candied walnuts and a mild garganzola. Next, I had a traditional Tagliatelle Zegna topped with a veal, pork & beef ragu bolognese style. “Mama Mia!” I ended the evening with an amazing tiramisu & an espresso. Everything was amazing but my heart was so touched by me sweet Miriam!

This was our first time dinning at the Roof Terrace before attending a show downstairs and I would have to say we really enjoyed our visit.

This is the perfect place for a nice romantic dinner date the ambiance and views are absolutely amazing and the foods not bad either🤣🤣🤣

Although it was a little pricey it was still worth the price of admission.  I was told that their Sunday brunch is amazing and I can’t wait to experience that next.

So once again if your looking to enjoy a nice dinner and a show at The Kennedy Center the Roof Terrace is the spot!!

RTR is a pretty good place for dinner before a show at the Kennedy Center. The restaurant has the classic aesthetic of the Kennedy Center with beautiful views from the terrace outside the restaurant. The staff were friendly enough though our waiter didn't talk with us too much. Food service was quick which is to be expected for those going to performances. The quality of the food is okay. All of our entrees were hot but just okay taste wise. Pretty good selection for vegetarians and the fish choices are nice too! We'll come back and try it again as we go to the KC often.

A solid experience one would expect from a prestigious venue like The Kennedy Center. Tremendous ambiance and service. The views from up there are spectacular and enrich the experience of an evening outing. The food was delicious, but not really stand out exceptional. Overall with everything considered, an incredible place that's perfect for a date night.

I have never been to the Kennedy Center and had no idea that there even was a restaurant. What a very nice dining experience. Santo our waiter was very knowledgeable with the food and drinks. It is a bit pricey but worth it. Even if you are not going to an event I highly recommend checking it out.

My husband and I visited the Kennedy Center last night to tour the new JFK exhibit, dine at the Roof Terrace and watched Wicked.  We had an amazing time.  The new exhibit is a great way to immerse yourself in all the aspects surrounding the creation of the National Cultural Center and the role the Kennedys played to make it a reality, which of course, contributed to the re-designation as the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.  The Roof Terrace is a very nice restaurant with the most friendly staff and an amazing view of the DC and Virginia skylines.  The only downside is the food is overpriced, in my opinion, for what you receive. The steak I ordered was really good and the lobster mac and cheese definitely did not skimp on the lobster.  The rest of our meal was good, but not at a level commensurate with the price.  You are definitely paying for the location; so just understand that going in.  I would like to re-state the staff were all very welcoming and made sure we had everything we needed.  There is a full bar, beer, and wine available.  The selection was a little small, but diverse.  One other tip, reservations are pretty much a must.  I made a reservation as soon as I purchased tickets for a show, so it was months in advance and I did not have any issues with availablility.  I have tried to make a reservation a week out before and it was booked solid; so just somethingto considerin advance of your visit.  Thank you again for another great evening enjoying the arts in our nation's capital.

Stopped in on a weekend trip for brunch and this Bakery is great! It’s easy to get to from the hotel and way better food than what the hotel had! Should’ve had breakfast here twice! The fresh biscuits and rolls were delicious! We tried the quiche and also liked that. Was a bit disappointed a lot of things that were on the menu weren’t available though when we went. With no clear signage that basically if those items aren’t in the case then they don’t have them. It’s always a peeve when then the host gets rude as if I, guest, am supposed to know that and where they store what; after rushing me forward to order when then other things aren’t prepared for the menu that were also full kitchen items. My host was a bit rude while their coworkers serving other guests seemed nicer and less abrasive. But all in all a great spot and he did NOT ruin my experience! They have this pepper jam by the pick up counter that was absolutely delicious! The prices were great too and liked how I could build out my sandwich to my dietary restrictions. They’re spacious with a great ambiance too! I really liked seeing their light fixtures which were really unique! I’d definitely go back again and recommend you stop in if you’re in the area.

The food was amazing and they even have frozen alcoholic slushies.  I had the gumbo and their specialty grilled cheese. Go check out the places. The people who work there have a beautiful spirit and you always feel welcomed. The place is like a small art museum with a bit of historical facts posted on the walls. Check it out. You'll definitely return. I know I will.

Out of this world biscuits. I should have gotten the pimento bacon egg biscuit because the cheese just melted everywhere and looked delicious but ended up getting the cheddar bacon egg biscuit because of my nightshade allergy. Also got the praline latte that was lip smacking good.

Would definitely recommend this place for a delicious breakfast stop before moving on to your day’s fun activities🥳

Amazing plan buttermilk biscuits!

We had a a sampler brunch and I’m sorry the photos do not do our food justice.  We carried out as it was too crowded to get a seat, and the food help up really well!

We had:
Plain buttermilk biscuits- THE SOFT AND FLUFFY STAR OF THE SHOW

Avocado Benedict - YUM!  Who doesn’t like runny egg on tater tot’s?!?

Beignets - which were light and tasty and dusted with powdered sugar.  BF did not see the point in them.

Cornbread.  I heard it was good but was WAY to fill to taste it.

An excellent latte that was lovely and NOT acidic / butter.

I was planning to give this place 4 stars, but my friend and I both had tummy troubles shortly after our meals. Outside of that, the meal was generally pretty tasty. Took about 30 mins from the time we got in line to get our food on a Saturday around 10 am. Things that can be improved was that the biscuit was a bit dry and sandwich was smaller than expected.

Loved the food and vibe here. We ordered the boneless wings (super crispy btw), chicken pot pie, fish and chips, nachos and couple of drinks .  Everything tasted  really good and wasn’t greasy! The service was super quick, the atmosphere was fun and lively, especially after 9pm with the live karaoke! Would definitely recommend this spot if you are looking for chill spot to hang with delish food, drinks, and music.

One of my favorite Irish pubs I have visited. Service is fast, customer service is top notch and the Fish and chips were quite impressive and generous in the portions. Not all supposed Irish pubs feel very authentic but this one fits the bill for drink selection, Irish atmosphere, good food, friendliness and an all around warm experience head to toe.

Great atmosphere, food and service.  Overall a welcoming and pleasant venue.  Big thanks to Mary -  Who put up with a rowdy bunch of Marines who may have forgotten they were not in the barracks.  I would go out of my way to come  here again.
We enjoyed this place. The only issue we had was the Yuengling draft did not taste right. Otherwise, it was a nice place. Service was great. I would recommend this place.

Great drinks and if you sit outside, it’s a nice place for people watching during the right time of day.  I had a few Carlsberg beers during happy hour and some delicious dinner while sitting outside, then I had a Solace beer and a friendly chat with another bar goer.  Later, I returned to listen to karaoke and possibly sing a song and have some more drinks; there was a decent crowd for a Wednesday, and I would visit again for the karaoke.

Really blown away by this place! First time we had it (today), we got takeout and everything was delicious! It was so good as takeout, so we’re definitely planning on going to eat in the restaurant. We ordered A LOT! The Buffalo Chicken Wrap (which I can say is my favorite - and I’ve had a lot of Buffalo chicken wraps), Lamb Gyro, Steak Quesadilla, Grilled Wings, and a side of Jambalaya (also one of my favorites and love that you can get it as a side!!) I honestly can’t wait to go back and try some more items.
Had a nice experience here on a Monday evening. They have happy hour till 6pm and also a trivia game that starts around 7pm. The servers were friendly and the food was good.

I stopped in for lunch between doctors appointments today and had a great experience. The food was good, the service was quick and attentive, and my frozen white peach margarita was great. I recommend the French dip and the house made voodoo chips! I would definitely come back.

This was my second time here. First time I was very pleased. They have pretty good food and drinks. This time was terrible. Not sure why my server was sitting down on her phone almost the entire time I was there. If you are going to be on the phone at least get my order correct. Or maybe don’t sit right where your guests can see you. The manager and other workers were helpful so it really does suck, but I will not return.

Fun and lively bar with a tasteful New Orleans theme. The food was great. I got jambalaya with blackened shrimp! The drinks were even better. Friendly staff and patrons, everyone down for a conversation.

Great scenery, food was okay but pricey. Would've expected a bigger portion for the price. Blackened salmon salad was some of the best salmon I've had. The boil pot was very small and only a few of each thing - maybe two slices of sausage. In my opinion there shouldn't be more potatoes / corn than meat. Crowded area, I would recommend getting a reservation ahead of time.

We were immediately seated but, our waiter didn’t come over to take our order. We stopped a lovely Spanish lady and she placed our order. This restaurant definitely caters to a specific race. The food was excellent. Customer service 👎

It was a beautiful day by the water. Cool breeze off the Potomac, and a sun that wasn't set to death as has been the case lately. I decided to venture to Tony and Joe's to sit and enjoy this spender. One item on the menu tickled my fancy the most. The steamed mussels. So I ordered them. As I set to distinguish the aforementioned bivalve molluscs, I noticed an oddly familiar item lodged inside one of them. Low and behold there's a French fry peaking out of a shell as if it belonged in it! When I notified the waitress, she apologized and offered to have it remade. No ma'am. Not at all. Of a matter of fact, check please. Now I'm no expert, but it seems to me for a French fry to find it's way into the shell of a mussel some level of cross contamination had to have likely occurred. And outside of a quick apology, I do not feel the matter was appropriately recognized and resolved. Unfortunately T&J, I will not be stepping foot into your establishment again. Thanks for trying, I guess.

It was very dark as you can see in the photos. I couldn't see what I was eating. No lighting of any kind(star taken). Have you ever seen dutch or Moscow mule in plastic cup? This was my first. Shrimp salad was so cold we could tell they prepared it long ago and kept it in a fridge. (star taken) Crispy chicken was good. Bronzino was good. Smoked salmon was a bit burned. Tables were wonky, no tissues on the table. 20% gratuity and %3 more if you don't pay in cash.(star taken)
Like my review and follow me to get to the good stuff 🤪

This restaurant is really large with seating available outside and inside. We sat inside because it was extremely hot outside. The food was okay, but overly priced. We ordered fried shaved Brussels sprouts and they came out burnt, but other than that the food and drinks were just okay.

The place is well located in heart of george town and decoration is beautiful for holidays. The staff are kind and service is fast. however the food itself is not the best. Also for the price of their pasta its portion is really small. To me there are much better places to eat in town that I would go next time.

Make sure you have a reservation, this place fills up and stays popular.  Delicious food!  We had meatloaf, beet salad (gold and red beets were really refreshing), ahi tuna with risotto was amazing (my dad ordered it two days in a row),  and smoked salmon plate. Everything was great!

An incredibly cool and historic restaurant! There’s so many awesome stories and pieces of history here but one of the most notable is probably the proposal booth where JFK proposed to Jackie! We sat in the Nixon booth and had an amazing experience. There was a long wait but you can walk around Georgetown and shop so we didn’t mind at all.
We had the French Onion Soup, Martin’s House Salad and the Chicken Milanese and all were delicious. It’s a busy place but it didn’t take long for our food to arrive. I’m definitely looking forward to going back.

This tavern boasts some impressive American history and a good menu. At each table there is a card with information about what booth U.S. presidents liked to sit at and the historical context at the time. The decor is so charming and immersive! I had the corned beef hash and it was incredible. Great destination spot in Georgetown.

Delicious turkey dinner with sweet potato purée and green beans. Fair salad and French onion soup. Good service. Decent prices for the portion size. And a very nice, classic atmosphere with interesting history. Does not feel stodgy.

Delicious authentic Mexican food!

We went here for brunch & it was a GREAT TIME!
The dishes all had great flavors!

Staff was welcoming, service was on point. Would highly recommend this place.

(Better to make reservations)

I liked the food, but I must say they position themselves on more of a fancy/gourmet side so everything is more expensive and less plentiful than we are used to seeing in Mexican restaurants. The cocktails are really good. The wait was unreasonably long although the first floor was empty. Every place seems to be understaffed these days. I'd recommend reservations.

Brunch was lovely. Would recommend for the price. Enjoyed the small plates and the drinks were good. The bloody was spicy and and mimosas were good, but not great, and flowed freely. Chiliquiles and tacos were great.

Best bottomless brunch ever!!! This place is a game changer when it comes to bottomless brunch! Food came out on perfect timing, drinks never stopped and the ambience was just too cheerful and pleasant!! Special shout out to our amazing server Joyce and Ed! They are excellent!

I went for brunch and was amazed that they had a tasting brunch menu with not only unlimited drinks, but with an unlimited tasting menu as well (only for 2 hours max). The food came out fast, was good and it's a good location to hang out with friends, catch-up and leave with a full stomach... and possibly...with a little buzz.

The plates consisted of tacos of pork, chicken and beef, plantains, nachos and more. Dessert was a delicious churro.

Would recommend for anyone looking for a brunch that's a good price and good amount.

Great place for a casual evening out. Ambience is lively and chirpy. Food is quite good, cocktails are top notch. Service was a tad slow but it could be because the place was nearly full. Definitely worth a revisit!

Stopped here because it wasn’t overly busy. The restaurant did fill up quickly as it got later at night. The food was good. We had nachos and burgers (1 regular & 1 veggie). The server checked in frequently. I would stop here again.
Easily and without a doubt the BEST BURGER that I’ve had in my life. WOW. Also, their french fries, which they personally cut in their own kitchen, were OUTSTANDING. This place deserves 100 stars!

While staying in Rosslyn we stopped at Rhodeside twice for evening libations and Sustenance. We found the drinks welcoming and the food Sufficiently Delectable and the service Excellently provided by Anastasia. Don’t hesitate to stop here

I visited the place as a single on a Satturday afternoon - mistake. It was very busy and extermly noisy. I had burger and beer. The burger was made from bread silces and overall very greasy! The fries were mushy and not freshly made. Sorry, but not for me, as I paid altogether (1x burger & 2x beer) 40 USD.

Wow this place is absolutely excellent, so glad we popped in for a birthday bite with family. As you walk in you are greeted by the doorman and hit with the elegance of the Ritz Carlton lobby. We sat in the lobby area to dine since the main area was under construction but that was not an issue at all, the lobby is lovely, great decor, relaxing yet fun music, excellent customer service from our lovely server Belinda and exemplary bartender Sherman. We had the cheeseboard, empanadas, and burrata salad and each was even more excellent than the one before. Sherman even surprised us with a delicious and elegant birthday pastry which was really the cherry on top of a perfect night. Belinda was patient, kind, and extremely professional with us. We cannot wait to be back.
The good and drinks were yummy. The service was great and the atmosphere pleasant. Yes, as others said a bit pricy but to be expected for the Ritz Carlton.

My nephew ordered a mocktail that was delicious, but he didn't like it. They removed it from the bill without us even asking and were incredibly kind. Things here are expensive, but it's the Ritz for a reason and their service is unmatched. I had no animosity towards my $20 house aged cocktail (The Frenchman) as it was potent, balanced, and served in a wonderful ambiance tucked away amidst all the action in Georgetown! While this Ritz may not scream luxury as every turn, it's in an incredible building that makes it a different adventure from the normal Ritz vibe.

I went there yesterday evening for drinks an appetizers and was shown amazing service by the bartender, who I think is named Louis. I asked him to mix us up something based on some broad descriptors (white spirit, spicy, booze forward) and he really delivered. He was very attentive and even gave us extra mustard jar minis when he overheard me gushing about how much I loved them. Just as we were leaving he gave us an explanation of Sauternes which he must have known I needed because he was talking with a coworker about them and I expressed confusion about it to my friends.
Overpriced, pretentious eatery inside an overpriced, pretentious hotel. The presentation was fantastic but the food was all bland. Did I mention it was overpriced? It was.

Food & drinks are great, just be prepared to pay (a lot) for them.

That said, the lamb chops were the best I've ever had. Paella was tasty as well, perfect for sharing with a group.

If you have cash burning a hole in your pocket, it can be well spent here. I may be back for those lamb chops!!

Great location right in the middle of Georgetown. Although the paella looks delicious, I was not a huge fan of it. Fortunately everything else we ordered turned out delicious: serrano tower with manchego, bacon wrapped dates, toast with cheese and honey, patatas bravas, and the obligatory glass of red wine. They also serve warm bread with quality evoo that was a nice surprise. The ambiance is nice, and we were seated right by a fireplace, which was nice given it was a cold day. In closing, we struggled a bit with the table size. Although we didn't order a lot of food, our tapas couldn't fit in the small tables. We kept having to rearrange plates and combine things. Other than that, it was a good experience.

I've never eaten at a Bodega before, neither has my wife. We were trying to entertain some out of town guests and after driving around in Adams Morgan for about 30 minutes trying to find parking, we decided to come to Georgetown instead. We were so relieved to find parking at a garage nearby and then just traveling on foot to see what options we had for food after 10pm. Bodega won for us. Me nor my wife couldn’t pronounce the foods they had on the menu good despite the English text in captions on the menus, which was a nice touch but that didn't matter to us as we were hungry. My wife, and our two guests had yhe same thing which was basically mashed potatoes, gravy, and green beans. I had lamb chops, a scoop of mashed potatoes with gravy and that was all that came on my plate as it looked like something a five year old would yet. I was expecting an actual meal. It was delicious but I left feeling hungry still. So glad that the Häagen-Dazs was still open as I gored on some chocolate peanut butter ice cream. Overall at the Bodega, great customer service, friendly staff, including from the managers / owners who were on hand. The atmosphere was quaint, dark and intimate. Price wise for all of us it came to $148 and that included two homemade sangrias, a martini, and a bottle of Estrella Dark for me. Never had it before and it was great. For four people in Georgetown? It's Georgetown folks and let's not forget inflation. I highly reccomend for folks that's trying to entertain out of town guests or celebrating a special occasion. In our case we were celebrating our anniversary weekend, a great panel we hosted at Awesome Con at the Convention Center, and finally being able to meet and hang out with our out of town friends. Give it shot!

Randomly stepped into this place and it was crowded and we sat at the bar. The portions sizes are small and it is pricey.

We were going to order the Paella but it was about 25 minutes to get that. We went with the hot tapas instead. They also gave bread and that was good. We had Tortilla Espanola which is basically a slice of omelette . It came with Mayo and was a bit salty for me , otherwise it was good. The Calamares  fritos was not bad too. Gambas al Ajillo (shrimp sauteed in garlic)was what my husband had and the garlic and olive oil in it was good with the bread they served. We also got the Brocheta de Pollo which were the chicken skewers with peppers and that was  the best dish personally.

I am totally addicted to Bodega! I love love looooove the ambiance, the excellent wine list, the warm service and, more importantly, the excellent tapas. They are by far the best price for quality, quantity and menu diversity in DC and I've been to most around. I wish they had a few more veggie options but no complaints. The Serrano Jamon, mussels & bread are the stuff of gods!If I lived in Georgetown, I'd possibly never cook dinner again. I highly recommend-- only if you leave me a seat at the bar 😉😉 seriously tho
